abstract_summ: • We must be vigilant of the critical neurological illnesses associated with COVID-19.• Patients COVID19 new-onset psychiatric symptoms because treatments or virus itself.• There are protean manifestations of cardiac involvement with COVID 19; • Hemorrhagic pericardial effusion may be the sole cardiac manifestation of COVID 19.• PRES is potentially a complication of severe SARS-CoV-2 infection.In this case report, we report a patient who presented with dysosmia, dysgeusia along with monocular peripheral vision loss after being diagnosed with Covid-19.To date, there have been reports of neurologic manifestations in COVID-19 patients including ischemic strokes, Guillain-Barre Syndrome and anosmia.We describe 2 hospitalized patients with confirmed coronavirus 19 (COVID-19) infection in whom brain imaging showed hemorrhagic posterior reversible encephalopathy syndrome, and we discuss the possible reasons for these findings and their relationship to the infection.We describe a COVID-19 patient who presented with persistent headache and anosmia that was related to viral encephalomyelitis with acute lesions on MRI in both the brain and upper cervical cord.In this case report, we describe a patient who presented with dysosmia, dysgeusia, along with monocular peripheral vision loss after being diagnosed with COVID-19.The clinical signs of coronavirus disease-19 (COVID-19) can be heterogenous because of the diversity of potential organ involvement.
title_summ: COVID-19-Associated Acute Disseminated Encephalomyelitis: A Case ReportACUTE VISION LOSS IN A PATIENT WITH COVID-19Acute Vision Loss in a Patient with COVID-19.Large vessel stroke and COVID-19: Case report and literature reviewCOVID-19 Presenting with SeizuresSARS-CoV-2 Fulminant MyocarditisEncephalopathy and seizure activity in a COVID-19 well controlled HIV patientAcute Transverse Myelitis Associated with SARS-CoV-2: A Case-ReportAffective psychosis after COVID-19 infection in a previously healthy patient: a case reportCase of Hemorrhagic Cardiac Tamponade in a Patient with COVID-19 InfectionPosterior reversible encephalopathy syndrome in severe SARS-COV-2 infectionComment on "Encephalopathy in patients with COVID-19: A review".Encephalomyelitis associated with Covid-19 infection: case report.Otologic and Audiologic Considerations for COVID-19.Optic nerve analysis in COVID-19 patients.Neurovascular Complications in COVID-19 Infection: Case Series.Bilateral transient olfactory bulbs edema during COVID-19-related anosmia.
